title: [BUG] kvsWebRTCClientMasterGstreamerSample.c Add peer failed. Max peer count reached on second connection
body:
**Describe the bug**
A kvsWebRTCClientMasterGstreamerSample.c with the following gst pipeline

 pipeline = gst_parse_launch(
"rpicamsrc keyframe-interval=30 "
"! queue "
"! h264parse "
"! video/x-h264,stream-format=byte-stream,alignment=au,profile=baseline "
"! appsink sync=TRUE emit-signals=TRUE name=appsink-video",
 &error);

only allows one connection, and never allows the same client to reconnect or different client to connect (video never shows up on a 2nd viewer or subsequent attempts of the same client) until the program is restarted. 

on second connection:
2020-07-12 21:35:05 DEBUG   iceAgentLogNewCandidate(): New remote ice candidate discovered. Id: CZjN9Eq7A. Ip: 18.219.39.23:64507. Type: host
**2020-07-12 21:35:05 WARN    turnConnectionAddPeer(): Add peer failed. Max peer count reached**
2020-07-12 21:35:05 ERROR   iceAgentAddRemoteCandidate(): operation returned status code: 0x0000000d


**SDK version number**
amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c  release version 1.2.0

**Open source building**
not a build issue - builds ok

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://awslabs.github.io/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-js/examples/index.html
2. Click on "start viewer", start streaming. 
3. Click on "stop viewer". 
4. Click on "start viewer", try starting streaming. - the video never starts although there is activity on the kvsWebRTCClientMasterGstreamerSample.c side

**Expected behavior**
Expected to have 10 simultaneous clients streaming or at least after the same client reconnects. 

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Streaming from RPi under latest Buster. Gstreamer 1.0 installed and functional outside of webrtc environemnt
 - Browser crome
 - Version Version 83.0.4103.116 (Official Build) (64-bit)

We had a forward declaration, but no implementation. Return STATUS_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
since we don't support renegotiation yet, so users shouldn't be using this.

Resolves: #604

title: [BUG] Sometimes the connection fails
body:
I have compiled Kinesis for a camera I'm working on, and it sometimes works great, for many hours.
However, there are sometimes that Kinesis stop sending packets and my streaming freezes. Since I'm using a local network, and the camera connection is always available, I don't think that is a connection problem. After this happens, Kinesis stop completing connections and never start sending packets to my remote host, even though it receives the connection request and prints its information on the terminal.
When this happens, my unique solution is to kill Kinesis and start it over again.
I wish to find exactly what is the cause, but I have no idea.
I have attached the complete log in this post. Here, I have initially a successfull connection that lasts for some minutes and latter, no other connection is possible.

[log_kinesis.txt](https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/files/4897859/log_kinesis.txt)

We're running the webrtc C SDK viewer on our device and do some abnormal user scenario testing.
We got the peer connection failure event (RTC_PEER_CONNECTION_STATE_CLOSED event from

We want to decrease the 30 second timeout to 15 or 20 seconds for better user experience; is there
an option or source code modification to achieve it ??
Thanks, A.J.

`// API call latency calculation
#define SIGNALING_API_LATENCY_CALCULATION(pClient, time, isCpApi) \
        MUTEX_LOCK((pClient)->diagnosticsLock); \
        if (isCpApi) { \
            (pClient)->diagnostics.cpApiLatency = EMA_ACCUMULATOR_GET_NEXT((pClient)->diagnostics.cpApiLatency, GETTIME() - (time)); \
        } else { \
            (pClient)->diagnostics.dpApiLatency = EMA_ACCUMULATOR_GET_NEXT((pClient)->diagnostics.dpApiLatency, GETTIME() - (time)); \
        } \
        MUTEX_UNLOCK((pClient)->diagnosticsLock); \`

```cpp
a=fmtp:97 apt=96
)";

  // LF -> CRLF
  auto lf = std::string(remoteSessionDescription);
  std::string crlf = "";
  for (auto c : lf) {
    if (c == '\n') {
      crlf += "\r\n";
    } else {
      crlf += c;
    }
  }

  strcpy(remoteSessionDescription, crlf.c_str());

  PRtcPeerConnection pRtcPeerConnection = NULL;
  PRtcRtpTransceiver pRtcRtpTransceiver = NULL;
  RtcConfiguration rtcConfiguration;
  RtcMediaStreamTrack rtcMediaStreamTrack;
  RtcRtpTransceiverInit rtcRtpTransceiverInit;
  RtcSessionDescriptionInit rtcSessionDescriptionInit;

  MEMSET(&rtcConfiguration, 0x00, SIZEOF(RtcConfiguration));
  MEMSET(&rtcMediaStreamTrack, 0x00, SIZEOF(RtcMediaStreamTrack));
  MEMSET(&rtcSessionDescriptionInit, 0x00, SIZEOF(RtcSessionDescriptionInit));

  EXPECT_EQ(createPeerConnection(&rtcConfiguration, &pRtcPeerConnection), STATUS_SUCCESS);
  EXPECT_EQ(addSupportedCodec(pRtcPeerConnection, RTC_CODEC_H264_PROFILE_42E01F_LEVEL_ASYMMETRY_ALLOWED_PACKETIZATION_MODE), STATUS_SUCCESS);

  rtcRtpTransceiverInit.direction = RTC_RTP_TRANSCEIVER_DIRECTION_RECVONLY;
  rtcMediaStreamTrack.kind = MEDIA_STREAM_TRACK_KIND_VIDEO;
  rtcMediaStreamTrack.codec = RTC_CODEC_H264_PROFILE_42E01F_LEVEL_ASYMMETRY_ALLOWED_PACKETIZATION_MODE;
  STRCPY(rtcMediaStreamTrack.streamId, "myKvsVideoStream");
  STRCPY(rtcMediaStreamTrack.trackId, "myTrack");
  EXPECT_EQ(addTransceiver(pRtcPeerConnection, &rtcMediaStreamTrack, &rtcRtpTransceiverInit, &pRtcRtpTransceiver), STATUS_SUCCESS);

  STRCPY(rtcSessionDescriptionInit.sdp, remoteSessionDescription);
  rtcSessionDescriptionInit.type = SDP_TYPE_OFFER;
  EXPECT_EQ(setRemoteDescription(pRtcPeerConnection, &rtcSessionDescriptionInit), STATUS_SUCCESS);
```



**Expected behavior**
CRLF line-endings are the default in SDP files, so it should work. Also the last line of the above SDP file has something to with it, even though it is perfectly valid SDP as far as I can see.

**Additional context**
My SDP contents are usually CRLF, but by simply converting them to LF the problem disappears. Since I found a workaround there's no high priority on this one. But since it is kind of a weird bug I figured I'd submit it anyway!

Also, I changed/obfuscated some of the fingerprints and hashes in the SDP since I'm not sure if sharing them is a security issue (in which case it probably is) - anyway if that causes any errors then that is not the cause of this bug. This is basically a somewhat truncated version of an SDP generated by Chrome.

title: [BUG] Example doesn't work properly when LWS is compiled with -DLWS_WITHOUT_SERVER=0
body:
**Describe the bug**
When LWS is compiled with `-DLWS_WITHOUT_SERVER=0`, the examples will stop working, signaling keeps failing to connect.

Although the bug won't cause any issue if the user compiles LWS with our provided script, some users can still be impacted if they use a pre-compiled version of LWS with `-DLWS_WITHOUT_SERVER=0`. 

**SDK version number**
https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/commit/b3b1a8e48f7dc4b165103bff5478440349cf49ed

**Open source building**
LWS: v3.2.3

**To Reproduce**

1. Compile LWS with `-DLWS_WITHOUT_SERVER=0`

title: [FEATURE] WebRTC Metrics
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
An application using the WebRTC SDK expects to monitor the performance of the underlying SDK performance and to provide the flexibility for the applications to take decisions based on a metric

**Describe the solution you'd like**
The application should be able to pull the metrics out periodically based on a type. The following is a broad list of metrics that would be tracked:

- [ ] ICE Candidate (@disa6302 )
- [ ] ICE Candidate Pair (@disa6302 )
- [x] ICE Server - #598 (@disa6302 )
- [ ] Inbound RTP Stats (@zhuker )
- [ ] Outbound RTP Stats (@zhuker )
- [ ] Transport Stats
- [x] Signaling - #577 (@MushMal )

Related to #576

title: [QUESTION] Delay after a few minutes of use in GStream
body:
I'm having delay issues with the kvsWebrtcClientMasterGstSample after a few minutes of streaming

So I took the kvsWebrtcClientMasterGstSample.c and try to us liv stream of my camera.
Th gstream pipeline I use is:
`"v4l2src device=/dev/video3 ! queue ! h264parse ! "
                        "video/x-h264 ,alignment=au ! "
                        "appsink sync=TRUE emit-signals=TRUE name=appsink-video"`

for 1-2 minutes everything works fine and there is no delay, after that I get a delay of like 2 sec.
Even if I close the connections (but the process keeps running) I get the same delay, like before, it seems like it is stuck in some kind of buffer that's never gets flushed.
Only if I kill the process and run it again, I get the stream in live for again 1-2 min until it gets delayed again. 

Be glad to attach any log if it required.
Thank you!

title: Add mbedTLS support
body:
Changes for mbedTLS specific implementation:
  * Add DTLS and TLS support
  * Add SRTP (media channel) and SCTP (data channel) support
  * Add common crypto defs
  * Create a new Crypto module
  * Move TLS and DTLS to Crypto module
  * Add pre-generated certificate and key support
  * Add unit tests  
  * Add end-to-end tests
  * Add a CI build for mbedTLS

Todo:
  * Create a memory/cpu footprint observation between OpenSSL vs mbedTLS
  * Reduce memory footprint by configuring mbedTLS to exclude unnecessary things
  * There are still some duplicated codes between OpenSSL and mbedTLS specific codes. I'm planning to do more refactoring in the future about this. But, for now, the goal is to avoid any regression with OpenSSL, it makes it easier to see the diff for the future PR.
  * Better pre-generated certificate library agnostic support

By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

title: [BUG] signaling messages don't reach to the kvsWebrtcClientMaster after a long period of idling
body:
**Describe the bug**

I use `kvsWebrtcClientMaster` and JavaScript SDK sample page to establish connection. When the viewer is started soon after the master is launched, signaling messages reach to `kvsWebrtcClientMaster`. However, a long time (> 1hour) is passed after it launches and if viewer send signaling messages, no signaling messages are reached to the master. I confirmed that signaling messages were sent on the channel from the CloudWatch metrics on the management console.

**SDK version number**
v1.2.0

**Open source building**
N/A

**To Reproduce**

1. Launch kvsWebrtcClientMaster
2. Wait an hour or more.
3. Start the viewer
4. No debug messages (e.g. `New remote ice candidate discovered` or `handleOffer(): time taken to send answer 3 ms`) is displayed on the console where master is running. "IceServerList" JSON log is displayed every 4.5 minutes.
5. There was signaling messages count at that time on the CloudWatch metrics.

I also confirmed that even after the step 4~5 is reproduced, waiting a few more hours and attempt the signaling from the viewer, the master sometimes receives signaling messages.

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: macOSX 10.14
 - Browser: Chrome
 - Version: 83.0.4103.106

Both the kvsWebrtcClientMaster and the viewer is running on the Mac above.

**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**
N/A

N/A

title: Merge free rtp packet
body:
*Issue #, if available:*
fix #518 
*Description of changes:*
RtpPacket should take ownership of its pRawPacket. pRawPacket is set in the following places:
- https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/master/src/source/PeerConnection/Rtp.c#L207
  - rawPacket is a copy and allocated at line https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/master/src/source/PeerConnection/Rtp.c#L203
- https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/master/src/source/PeerConnection/Rtp.c#L216
  - rawPacket is a copy and allocated at line https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/master/src/source/PeerConnection/Rtp.c#L203
- https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/master/src/source/Rtp/RtpPacket.c#L113
  - createRtpPacketFromBytes is called in https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/6f741f4c6830fcad7eb2ccb9f07f38367ee7fb40/src/source/Rtcp/RtpRollingBuffer.c#L66 and https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/b2d1600c62ac14f1a7c4557f914086d195caccd6/src/source/PeerConnection/PeerConnection.c#L187, in both places the rawPacket is a copy
- https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/93dbd03699b9eaaa9c173de888da7e0dd2f5daec/src/source/Rtp/RtpPacket.c#L158. pRawPacket is allocated and copied

Since pRawPacket is always a copy owned by pRtpPacket, it should be safe to free pRawPacket also when free pRtpPacket.

title: Replace RAND_bytes with RAND
body:
The goal for this PR is to remove an unnecessary dependency to OpenSSL. Since this is only for generating random JSON safe string, which is being used for IDs, there shouldn't be any need to generate cryptographically strong pseudo-random bytes, https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.0.2/man3/RAND_bytes.html.

title: [QUESTION] the compile option of libwebsocket
body:
A one liner description about the use case and what you are trying to achieve
the compile option of libwebsocket.

** Any design considerations/constraints **
Explain in detail how you would like to integrate our SDK into your solution 

Recently, I am working on porting this sdk on non-linux based RTOS. 
For libwebsocket, I am trying to disable the compile options of libwebsocket as much as I can in order to lessen the effort of porting, since this sdk is the only one uses libwebsocket on this platform right now.
So I have one question, is it all the compile option or all the feature inside libwebsocket necessary for this sdk? In other word, what is necessary feature set of libwebsocket for this sdk? 

For example, I disabled two compile options as below in libwebsocket, and the sample code of master role still worked well.

if (LWS_WITH_ESP32)
option(LWS_WITH_DIR "Directory scanning api support" OFF)
option(LWS_WITH_LEJP_CONF "With LEJP configuration parser as used by lwsws" OFF)
else()
option(LWS_WITH_DIR "Directory scanning api support" ON)
option(LWS_WITH_LEJP_CONF "With LEJP configuration parser as used by lwsws" ON)
endif()

title: log ice candidate protocol type. change sample to handle upcoming get…

…IceServerConfigChange. Other minor fixs.

getIceServerConfig will soon return urls in follow forms:
  - turn:ip:port?transport=udp
  - turns:ip:port?transport=udp
  - turns:ip:port?transport=tcp

Originally in Common.c we are manually appending the query param. It's removed in this commit. After this commit and before the getIceServerConfig change, ICE will try both TURN over UDP and TURN over TCP/TLS.

title: Decouple SocketConnection from OpenSSL
body:
The goal for this PR is to decouple Ice from OpenSSL so that we can easily swap the TLS implementation with mbedTLS (https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/issues/121).

`TlsSession` is intentionally designed to be similar to our current `DtlsSession`. The idea is that if the interfaces are similar, we can merge these 2 easily in the future, and have a single proxy class that can swap between DTLS and TLS with a single flag.

title: [QUESTION] How to stream video from this client into KVS for analytics
body:
We would like to process WebRTC conference calls using AWS KVS (analytics) and are hoping to (1) use AWS KVS WebRTC to act as the signaling server; (2) use this client to receive all of the WebRTC streams; and (3) forward all of those streams to the AWS KVS (analytics) service for doing real-time video/audio processing in AWS Lambda.

** Any design considerations/constraints **
Ideally, this SDK could be deployed in a headless, autoscaling fashion (eg. lambda or fargate). The input would be a webrtc room id (hosted by AWS KVS WebRTC) and this client would connect to the WebRTC room. Then, this client would forward all information into AWS KVS (analytics) .

Note: The distinction between AWS KVS WebRTC and "ordinary" KVS is a little confusing. I understand that the KVS WebRTC service is just an autoscaling signaling server for WebRTC, while "ordinary" KVS or KVS (analytics) is for processing video streams. Ideally, we could use the KVS WebRTC server as a media server that automatically forwards client feeds into KVS (analytics), but that does not seem to be possible. Thus, we would need a this headless webrtc client (or another headless client) to receive audio/video and forward it to KVS (analytics).

** If you would not like to open an issue to discuss your solution in open-platform, please email your question to kinesis-video-support@amazon.com **

title: Refactor peer certificate verification out of srtp allocation
body:
Currently, our DTLS implementation only verifies peer certificates using the fingerprint from the offer/answer SDP. But, if the users only use data channels, the peer certificates will pass without any verification.

*Update: It turns out that we'll always allocate SRTP, so the peer certificate will always get verified. So, to avoid confusion, the PR has been updated to move out the verification out of SRTP allocation.*

title: [FEATURE] gstreamer sink and source component
body:
Dear developers,

There is an example `kvsWebRTCClientMasterGstreamerSample.c` which sets up a fixed gstreamer pipeline that is created in C code.
However there are no gstreamer components built, that could be used in a custom pipeline out of the box (using shell command gst-launch-1.0).

What I would expect is to have a sink and as source component(s) for gstreamer that could be used in custom pipelines. Something similar to this: https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-producer-sdk-cpp/blob/master/src/gstreamer/gstkvssink.cpp

The gstreamer component could have:

- input pad for video h264 frames (in case of Master mode, for Viewer mode it should be optional pad)
- input pad for audio frames (in case of Master mode, for Viewer mode it should be optional pad)
- input pad for data channel messages
- output pad for data channel messages
- output pad for video h264 frames (in case of Viewer mode, for Master mode it should be optional pad)
- output pad for audio frames (in case of Viewer mode, for Master mode it should be optional pad)
 

Maybe it is possible to have only one gstreamer component that has a parameter selecting Master or Viewer mode.
Also other parameters regarding IoT authentication are needed, just like in gstkvssink.cpp.

Cheers,

Mateusz

title: [BUG]Memory is not released completely after session disconnecting
body:
**Describe the bug**
The memory usage rate is increasing during the connection.

I have customized the following params to reduce the size of the rolling buffers.
https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/blob/master/src/source/PeerConnection/Rtp.h#L11-L12
```
#define DEFAULT_ROLLING_BUFFER_DURATION_IN_SECONDS              1
#define HIGHEST_EXPECTED_BIT_RATE                               (2 * 1024 * 1024)
```
I added the definitions in CMakeLists.txt. And reset the allocators in code.
`	add_definitions(-DINSTRUMENTED_ALLOCATORS)`
`SET_INSTRUMENTED_ALLOCATORS();`
It print the size of allocation regularly as follows:
GetAllocationSize,==-=>size[71926]!

When I connected to the device for a while, the memory usage increased to 2891417. From 71926 to 2829102. After disconnecting the memory usage decreased to 1103593 which was higer than before.

This phenomenon does not happen every time. Usually it occurs when the network is not good enough or the devices and viewers are under different networks. When I use the master and viewer in our office, it is hard to reprodure. However, preview elsewhere easily to reproduce.

Here is the full log.
[master.log](https://github.com/awslabs/amazon-kinesis-video-streams-webrtc-sdk-c/files/4729944/master.log)
